result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R Kippley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur & concur to 14CF1675. Crt finds early termination of probation upon completion in 14CF1675 upon recommendation of PO agent.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 provided def has no ATR's or revocations or commits no new charges rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes: 12/22/15 Crt amends the length of probation on ct 2 to 1 yr from 3 yrs.

miscConds.notes: $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R Kippley
